description.narrative:
The Eurodad International Conference 2017, co-hosted with ActionAid Netherlands, Both Ends, Latindadd, OIKOS, Oxfam Novib, SOMO is between 20-22 June 2017 in the Hague. Eurodad is a network of 47 NGOs from 20 European countries, and the Eurodad biannual conference is a leading forum for discussion, idea-sharing and collective strategizing for anti-poverty civil society groups advocating for reform of development finance. The main aim of this conference is to challenge current (financing) policies for development, debate the future of development policies and influence key (political) actors.
The Eurodad conference will bring together around 150 leading civil society thinkers from around the globe working on issues ranging from debt, tax justice, aid, private finance, the International Financial Institutions (IFIs) and global monetary reform. Held at least every two years for over a decade, the conference allows Eurodad members, allies and partners to broaden understanding of key issues, identify and move forward on collective struggles, forge new alliances and meet inspiring people. Experts from academia and other leading thinkers will provide additional stimulus, andallow us to break out of our traditional habits when strategizing and planning for the future. Oxfam Novib contributes #12.000 of the total #126.665 for the entire conference, which will be shared by five organisations: Eurodad, Both Ends, Somo, Oxfam Novib and Action Aid Netherlands, as well as by external funds.

participating-org.narrative:
Eurodad (the European Network on Debt and Development) is a network of 47 civil society organisations (CSOs) from 20 European countries, which works for transformative yet specific changes to global and European policies, institutions, rules and structures to ensure a democratically controlled, environmentally sustainable financial and economic system that works to eradicate poverty and ensure human rights for all.
Their focus is on strengthening the power of European CSOs, working as part of a global movement to push governments and powerful institutions to adopt transformative changes to the global economic and financial system.
Eurodad's Strategic Plan sets ambitious goals to help achieve: tax justice to stem the loss of resources in developing countries; ending debt crises that hinder economic progress; effective aid that will transform lives; publicly-backed private finance and investment agreements that accelerate development results; climate finance that is responsive to the climate adaptation and mitigation priorities of developing countries; and financial sector rules that promote prosperity and do no harm. Eurodad also has crosscutting priorities, which we integrate into all our work, of gender equality, global economic good governance, and responsible finance standards.
The main institutions targeted by the Eurodad network include European governments, the World Bank, the United Nations, International Monetary Fund and the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
